importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article indicates the current state of food supply conditions in Gaza, highlighting the urgency of humanitarian intervention during the ongoing conflict.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Gaza, specifically food shortages, is unfolding in the current year, emphasizing the immediate need for sustained international aid efforts.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza are significantly below the WFP's daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 metric tonnes entering daily.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—are currently operational, severely limiting aid flow.
The WFP operates 26 food distribution points in Gaza, up from five, but still far short of the target of 145 distribution points.
Humanitarian aid has reached northern Gaza via southern routes, but not in large-scale convoys; access to key areas like Gaza City and Salah al-Din Street remains restricted.
The ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump is described as vital for saving lives and preventing famine in northern Gaza.
Hamas has pledged to return 28 captives’ bodies, having handed over 13 so far, with the Rafah crossing remaining closed until further notice.
Many Palestinians are storing food due to uncertainty about the ceasefire’s longevity and future conflict risks.

namedEntities.name: WFP
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The United Nations World Food Programme
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is directly involved in assessing and reporting on food supply levels in Gaza, providing critical data on humanitarian needs and distribution challenges.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He brokered a ceasefire, and his 20-point plan includes provisions for full humanitarian aid to Gaza, making him a central figure in the political and humanitarian framework.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He has stated that the Rafah crossing remains closed until Hamas returns the bodies of deceased captives, influencing access to humanitarian routes and aid flow.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: One of the two currently open crossings into Gaza, allowing humanitarian aid to enter but limited in capacity and scope.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kissufim)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The second operational crossing, located in the center of Gaza, enables limited aid delivery, but overall access remains constrained.

namedEntities.name: Rafah
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Border crossing between Gaza and Egypt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It remains closed by Israeli authorities, restricting humanitarian access to northern Gaza and further limiting food distribution.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP was denied permission to use this key north-south route, which would have allowed more efficient and widespread distribution of food in northern Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This group has pledged and partially fulfilled the return of Israeli captives' bodies, which is a condition for the reopening of certain border crossings and humanitarian access.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is central to the prisoner exchange negotiations and has announced the return of captives’ remains, which affects ceasefire stability and aid access.

namedEntities.name: US President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His diplomatic initiative brokered the ceasefire and includes a plan for full aid to Gaza, directly shaping the humanitarian situation described in the article.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme reports that food supplies to Gaza remain critically short, with only 750 metric tonnes per day entering—far below the 2,000-tonne target—due to just two open border crossings. While the number of food distribution points has increased from five to 26, the WFP still falls short of its goal of 145 points. Humanitarian aid is reaching northern areas through southern routes, but access to key locations like Gaza City and Salah al-Din Street is blocked. The ceasefire brokered by former US President Donald Trump is described as vital to prevent famine, and Hamas has so far delivered 13 of 28 pledged captives' bodies, with the Rafah crossing remaining closed until further notice. Many Palestinians are storing food due to fears of renewed conflict, indicating deep uncertainty about the ceasefire’s sustainability.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
